intro: Vahlia digyna, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Indian nettle plant, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded areas. Vahlia digyna is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
